snippet: In a statement issued on Monday, a Walmart spokeswoman emphasized that the company believed their driver “was operating within the federal hours of service regulations.”
abstract: New Jersey prosecutors charge Kevin Roper, Walmart driver whose truck collided with a van on the New Jersey Turnpike carrying comedian Tracy Morgan and other performers, with one count of death by auto and several counts of assault by auto; say driver had not slept for more than 24 hours before crash; comedian James McNair, known as Jimmy Mack, was killed, and Morgan was critically injured.
lead_paragraph: In a statement issued on Monday, a Walmart spokeswoman emphasized that the company believed their driver “was operating within the federal hours of service regulations.”

headline.main: Driver Charged in Crash Involving Tracy Morgan Had Not Slept in 24 Hours, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: Driver Charged in Fatal Crash Had Not Slept in 24 Hours, Prosecutors Say
